summary: I am cultural anthropologist by training  and engaged with the world around me by nature. I enjoy bridging different perspectives and bringing people together. Being personally involved and helping to make a difference is what makes me tick.

treasury_media.title: The importance of community: we need to connect the dots | Rosalinde Spitters | TEDxLeidenUniversity
treasury_media.description: In this talk I argue that stress within higher education is a cultural problem that we can only face as a community.

profile_positions.description: I am the faculty wide contact person for Student Wellbeing of the Faculty of Social and Behavioral Sciences at the Leiden University. The POPcorner FSW team is responsible for this topic on the faculty level. We aim to improve student wellbeing through facilities and interventions within and outside of the curricula of the FSW institutes. All of our support is co-created with our students and in close collaboration with other student support staff and teachers.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator Student Wellbeing within POPcorner FSW

profile_positions.description:
The POPcorner was first developed by the Faculty of Social and Behavioral Sciences in Leiden and has built up more than a decade of experience, which is collected within its support facilities. It’s very important to us that all students get off to a good start, whether in Leiden or The Hague. The POPcorner The Hague helps students find their way at the campus and during their studies. We also facilitate student4student activities, through which students can work on their personal and professional development while supporting their peers.

POPcorners are meeting points run for and by students, where students can get to know peers, attend workshops and events, or organise activities for fellow students. We aim to contribute to a diverse and inclusive university community by supporting students with regard to academic and social connectedness. In doing so we want to contribute to student well-being, to stimulate engagement with society and to enhance study success.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator POPcorner The Hague

profile_positions.description:
The pilot course 'FSW Skills Academy' is now turned into a faculty wide elective for students from the Faculty of Social and Behavioural Sciences (starting September 2018). I coordinate this course which aims to prepare students for their future profession by offering them the opportunity to gain experience in a real life consultancy case as a backdrop to train 21st century skills. They will do so in multi-disciplinary teams of 5 students. During the course students will practice both personal as well as professional skills. They combine making an impact in society with reflections on their personal development and goals for the future.

I am very excited about this combination of skill training and reflection because I believe it will give the students valuable practical experience as well as confidence about their own capacities and goals.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator and skills teacher Personal and Professional Impact

profile_positions.location: Department of Cultural Anthropology and Development Sociology (Social Sciences)
profile_positions.description:
I guide and coach bachelor students both academically and personally. I clarify program requirements, procedures and regulations. I actively monitor students' progress.  I also represent the institute at open door days during which I inform prospective students about CA-DS. 

As a Study Advisor my main focus is to improve study success and to help students make the best of their time within the university.

Until March 2018 I have been actively involved as a member of the educational committee and the institute board. I suggested and implemented policy and process improvements. Between November 2012 and March 2018 I also coordinated the bachelor internships and the bachelor thesis (the latter for 1 year), I gave work groups to first year students, I maintained the e-Prospectus and I admitted exchange students to our electives. I supported our institute manager and our secretariat within various projects and I supported our staff member communication in writing/editing our web pages and brochure.
profile_positions.title: Study Advisor Cultural Anthropology and Development Sociology

profile_positions.location: Department of Cultural Anthropology and Development Sociology (Social Sciences)
profile_positions.description:
I coordinated orientation to the job market within the bachelor and master of CA-DS. The trajectory consists of a wide range of activities that are available to students throughout their studies. Academic and research skills are trained within the curriculum. Other relevant skills can be trained through participation in co curricular and extra curricular events. Students not only train skills, they are also encouraged to reflect on their choices and made aware of their added value as cultural anthropologists on the job market. 

I drew attention to internship opportunities and monitored internship projects. I maintained and built a network of organizations and alumni. Within the trajectory I collaborated with the Career Services in the faculty and the University. 

The main goal is for students to know what they want and to give them the confidence and competence to successfully take the step to the job market. 

The trajectory was marked as a best practice within the University.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator of job market orientation and internships

profile_positions.description: To improve the positions of the students of Social and Behavioral Sciences in the job market, the Centre for Innovation and the Faculty of Social and Behavioral Sciences developed the pilot training course: FSW Skills Academy. The course consisted of a set of workshops that trained practical and personal skills in addition to (academic) professional and theoretical skills. My tasks within the team were promoting the course among students, individually coaching participants in achieving their personal learning goals, communication and creating support within the faculty.
profile_positions.title: Project member FSW Skills Academy

profile_positions.description: Conducting and transcribing interviews for Dr. Igor Boog's PhD-research on cultural diversity in the Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Task: Supervising and assisting students while they are doing their homework, motivating, structuring and maintaining an orderly atmosphere.

When asked for providing additional lessons in one specific subject on an individual basis.
profile_positions.title: Tutor Gymnasium Haganum

profile_positions.description: I conducted my MA research within this health care institution. In order to collect the relevant data I conducted participant observations in three locations that provide the same type of care. Besides these observations I collected data through semi structured  and open interviews with employees, cliënts and their parents
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description: I worked at the Kirkwall Youth Hostel on Orkney during the summer. Hostess, Reception, Cleaning.
profile_positions.title: Member of staff

volunteer_experiences.description: For three months (Februari and October 2014 and March 2015) I volunteered at a sanctuary for old, sick, disabled and discarded elephants in Thailand. The elephants that lived there, did not have to work (anymore) and spent their day in a peaceful and natural environment. I worked about 6 days a week for 3 months. Most of the work consisted of taking care of the elephants, guiding visitors and doing administration. It was a dream come true to work with these magnificent and highly intelligent animals. It has been one of the most amazing things I have done in my life...
